paper_abstract: This paper is devoted to the analysis of the l(infinity) and L-infinity gains for positive linear systems with interval time-varying delays. Through exploiting the monotonicity of the state trajectory, we first prove that for positive systems with constant delays, the l(infinity) and L-infinity gains are fully governed by the system matrices but independent of the delay size. Moreover, for positive systems with bounded time-varying delays, by comparing with the nominal systems with constant delays, it turns out that the l(infinity) and L-infinity gains are exactly the same as that of the constant delay systems. The results in this paper reveal that the l(infinity) and L-infinity gains of positive linear systems are not sensitive to the magnitude of time delays and hence the computation of l(infinity) and L-infinity gains of positive systems with bounded time-varying delays can be reduced to computing the l(infinity) and L-infinity gains of the corresponding delay-free systems. Both continuous-time and discrete-time cases are considered in this paper.
paper_title: On l(infinity) and L-infinity gains for positive systems with bounded time-varying delays
